text-node.description: Should be used only for simple UI
Cart-UpdateLineItem

pipelet-node.custom-name: Clear all saved Basket level data

pipelet-node.description: Call GetBasket here because the current Basket in session is disconnected from the newly logged in customer.

text-node.description: Redirects the user to the last visited catalog URL as implemented in the custom script.
Updates an existing product line item with a new product, new options, and/or a new quantity. params: just like miniaddproduct i.e. pid, options, quantiy.
Determines some needed objects based on the current form values.

decision-node.description: Do not validate cart again if it was already calculated in same request and an error was reported. Preserve existing basket errors

text-node.description: By default, when a bundle is added to cart all its sub products gets added too, but if those products happens to be variants then we have to manually replace the master products with the selected variants which gets passed in the http params as childPids along with any options. Params: CurrentHttpParameterMap.childPids - comma separated list of pids of the bundled products which are variations
Adds multiple products to the basket. Uses multiple product IDs separated by comma.
Adds the product with the given ID to the wish list.
Inserts the Wish List into the pipeline dictionary if the customer is authenticated.
Renders a minified version of the basket.
SAL-607 - Set default shipping address and shipping method, so taxes can be calcuated. Removed pipelet: Call node - Cart-Calculate
Add product to mini cart. Renders a new mini cart and not a full cart.
The following 2 scripts and call node were added to calculate shipping costs for the cart page instead of the using the default value
The cart page provides various actions to be performed, e.g. line item editing, coupon redemption etc.
If the user is logged in successfully, take it to the checkout page.
Login and present the user refreshed cart with any changes e.g. user specific promotions etc.

Determines an existing basket from the current session. If a basket wasn't found, the pipeline ends in a named end node "error". This node can be used in other pipelines such as the checkout pipelines in order to access the basket. This pipeline does not create a new basket. Calling pipelines are responsible to properly react on the "error" end node.

Determines an existing basket from the current session. If a basket wasn't found, a new basket is created. If a new basket couldn't be created, the pipeline ends in a named end node "error". Calling pipelines are responsible to properly react on the "error" end node.
Calculates an existing basket. Call this pipeline always if the changes to the basket content is made (e.g. addition or removal of a product or gift certificate or setting of a shipping method).
Start the checkout process.

pipelet-node.custom-name: Validates the basket against additional conditions

text-node.description: Reorder logic used to order same products from a previous successful order
New basket after successful order so reassign the discount model coupon for this customer.
Create the basket if there isn't one
Add bonus product to cart.
Add a sub product to the bonus product bundle.
When adding a new product to the cart check to see if it has triggered a new bonus discount line item.
This pipeline is used to add items from the quick order form to the cart if the product has a valid SKU and quantity and ignores inventory status of the products.

pipelet-node.description: Need to use this pipelet instead of UpdateObjectFromForm since the latter one doesn't support recursive lists yet.

text-node.description: This pipeline is used foradding all product list items to the cart from "My Lists"
Remove all products from the cart
This Pipeline will check the instore qty against the store inventory in the case that the pli's qtyt has been updated.
SAL-607. Update the cart/basket when a user selects a new shipping address.
Reads POST data and adds one or more products to the basket
No basket? No Problem. No need to update.
